facts.text: Gerbert of Aurillac elected as 1st French Pope
Alfonso V succeeds his father as king of Aragon
Mehmed II begins his siege of Constantinople (İstanbul), which would fall on May 29.
Florida discovered, claimed for Spain by Ponce de Leon
Jews are expelled from Genoa Italy
England & France sign 1st Treaty of Le Cateau-Cambrésis
States-General appoints earl Mauritius, viceroy of Utrecht
Cornelis de Houtman's ships depart to Asia through Cape of Good Hope
Robert Devereux resigns as parliament supreme commander
Commodore William James captures the pirate fortress of Suvarnadurg on west coast of India.
The Coinage Act is passed establishing the United States Mint and authorizing the $10 Eagle, $5 half-Eagle & 2.50 quarter-Eagle gold coins & silver dollar, ½ dollar, quarter, dime & half-dime
1st performance of Ludwig van Beethoven's 1st Symphony in C
